content: As an advanced reading comprehension assistant, your task is to analyze text passages and corresponding questions meticulously. Your response start after "Thought: ", where you will methodically break down the reasoning process, illustrating how you arrive at conclusions. Conclude with "Answer: " to present a concise, definitive response, devoid of additional elaborations, and keep the same writing style as the found source text if the question is a open-ended question else you can answer just Yes or No.

What are the skills learning outcomes for the Data Structures and Algorithms course? 
Answer: analyzing algorithms, generalize data, and algorithm settings.

Wikipedia Title: Course ID: MTH00031
Course Abstract Algebra (ID: MTH00031) falls under the Compulsory category and is scheduled for the even semester. The instructor is Trinh Thanh Deo. Note: It requires prior completion of Linear Algebra. Learning outcomes expected: The goal of the course is to equip students with basic abstract algebraic structures, to help them become familiar with symbols and formal calculations.. The course discusses: The course introduces basic algebraic structures such as groups, rings, integer domains, fields, and polynomial rings on fields. Some special concepts introduced are permutation group, alternating group, cyclic group, polynomial ring on number fields, especially on rational number fields..

Wikipedia Title: Course ID: MTH10121
Elementary Algebra (ID: MTH10121) is a Elective subject conducted during the even semester. The course is instructed by Ta Thi Nguyet Nga, and it There are no prerequisites for this course. Upon completion, students will achieve: This course addresses issues related to methods and strategies for solving problems, equations and systems of equations, inequalities and extremum conditions, combinatorial algebra, and methods for solving problems related to sequences and series.
Knowledge: Overview of foundational knowledge in algebra.
Skills & competences: Selecting appropriate theoretical foundations to solve corresponding exercises. Proactively updating and improving new teaching methods.. The course includes: This module includes the following topics:
Methods and strategies for problem solving.
Equations and systems of equations
Inequalities and extremum 
Combinatorial algebra
Methods for solving problems of sequences and series..

Wikipedia Title: Course ID: MTH10119
Teaching Mathematics in English 1 is a Elective course (ID: MTH10119) available in the even semester. It is led by Ta Thi Nguyet Nga. Prerequisites: none. The course aims to deliver the following outcomes: This course is designed to equip students with the skills and strategies needed to effectively teach mathematics using English as the medium of instruction. Participants will explore techniques for creating a language-rich math classroom, fostering mathematical communication, and supporting English language learners in understanding and solving mathematical problems. The course aims to empower students to facilitate a seamless integration of mathematics and language learning.
By the end of this course, students should be able to:
Understand the importance of the structure and concepts in teaching mathematics in English.

Develop strategies for explaining mathematical concepts clearly in English.
Promote mathematical communication and language development.
Adapt instructional materials to support English language learners.
Create a language-rich math classroom environment.
Evaluate the effectiveness of English-medium math instruction.. Main content: Operation Review
Algebra
Basic Geometry
Trigonometry 
Probability and Statistics 
Calculus.

Wikipedia Title: Course ID: MTH10123
Course Application of Advanced Mathematical Methods in Solving Complex High School's Mathematics Problem (ID: MTH10123) falls under the Elective category and is scheduled for the odd semester. The instructor is Ta Thi Nguyet Nga. Note: There are no prerequisites for this course. Learning outcomes expected: Equip students with advanced mathematical knowledge through various applications to solve problems in the high school curriculum. This helps students reinforce and enhance their advanced mathematical knowledge, while also teaching them how to solve everyday problems using modern and elegant tools.
Knowledge: advanced mathematical knowledge in solving problems
Skills & competences: solving everyday problems using modern and elegant tools.. The course discusses: This module includes some of the following topics: (change over year)
Applications of Mathematical Analysis
Applications of Advanced Geometry
Applications of Graph Theory
Applications of Group Theory
Applications of Symmetric Polynomials.

Wikipedia Title: Course ID: MTH00084
In the even semester, students can take Abstract Algebra Practice (code: MTH00084). It is taught by Nguyen Kim Ngoc, categorized as a Compulsory course. It requires prior completion of Linear Algebra, Linear Algebra Practice. Learning outcomes include: General Objective: To equip students with basic computational skills in abstract algebraic structures, formal calculation, giving them a better understanding of these algebraic structures. Use softwares (e.g. GAP) to calculate specific examples and exercises.
Specific objectives/course learning outcomes:
Knowledge: Master the theory of basic algebraic structures such as groups, rings, fields, and polynomial rings. Get hands-on with software (e.g. GAP) to better understand the structure learned.
Skills: Improve reasoning skill and formal calculation.
Attitude, diligence: Serious, progressive.. Topics covered in this course are: The goal is to practice basic computational skills on algebraic structures such as groups, rings, integral domains, and fields, and use software (e.g. GAP) to better understand the structure of theories learned..
